thread.section_title: The Union Democrat, Sonora, CA News, Sports, & Weather
thread.title: News of Record for Oct. 13, 2015

title: News of Record for Oct. 13, 2015
text: News of Record for Oct. 13, 2015 News of Record for Oct. 13, 2015 By Union Democrat staff October 13, 2015 01:00 am TUOLUMNE COUNTY The Sonora Police Department reported the following: FRIDAY 4:10 a.m., public peace — A woman banged on an RV’s windows outside a Sanguinetti Road business and yelled. After officers arrived, she agreed to leave the area. 11:03 a.m., public peace — A woman driving a motorhome on Hospital Road reportedly tried to hit a man as he jumped out. The man yelled and threw rocks at the woman. 11:30 a.m., theft — A woman reported her purse was stolen at an Old Wards Ferry Road business within the past two weeks. 5:44 p.m., theft — Tools were stolen out of the back of a truck on South Poplar Street. SATURDAY 11:15 a.m., suspicious circumstances — A man and a woman attempted to break into an abandoned house off of South Washington and Lytton streets. 6:13 p.m., public peace — A man and a woman fought while driving away from a Sanguinetti Road business. SUNDAY 12:29 p.m., animal complaint — Two dogs were locked in a vehicle for over an hour outside at a Sanguinetti Road business. 9:47 p.m., public peace — A woman was screaming and banging on the walls at a South Green Street residence. An officer advised her to stay in her room that night. The Sheriff’s Office reported the following: FRIDAY 3:26 a.m., Sonora — A woman was heard screaming on Elsey Court. 7:51 a.m., Soulsbyville — Someone said a coyote or possibly a dog was in a trap on Soulsbyville Road. 10:59 a.m., Twain Harte — Someone on Michigan Drive said a vehicle was stolen within the past month. 1:26 p.m., Pinecrest — A Sugar Pine Avenue woman said the front and back entrances of her cabin were open. 5:34 p.m., Twain Harte — Two dogs were running loose and acting aggressively on Sierra Drive. 6:06 p.m., Sonora — A blond man wearing a blue/green tank top and blue jeans walked down Stable Road, threatened people and “acted crazy.” 6:57 p.m., Sonora — A man with gray hair, wearing sunglasses, a khaki shirt and cargo shorts was in front of a Mono Way business offering ice cream to kids. He followed juveniles into a store and came out and sat on a bench 7:07 p.m., Sonora — A Poco Calle resident threatened to burn their neighbor’s house down. 7:07 p.m., Sonora — A Stable Road man was attacked by a man wearing blue shorts, flip-flops and a red hoodie. 6:51 p.m., Groveland — Kids on Highway 120 picked up the back end of a woman’s vehicle and moved it, causing it to not start properly. 10:53 p.m., Jamestown — A rock was thrown at the windshield of a Preston Lane vehicle. 11:59 p.m., La Grange — A man was hitting walls, screaming and “going crazy” because his girlfriend left. SATURDAY 12:01 a.m., La Grange — Someone on Las Palmas Way said a man was “going crazy” at a neighbor’s residence. 7:46 p.m., Twain Harte — Someone on Lakeview Drive said a woman was yelling, crying and speaking Arabic at Twain Harte Lake. 8:20 p.m., Jamestown — A man on Main Street said he was attacked by transients. SUNDAY 9:43 a.m., Tuolumne — A naked person with corn-rowed hair was walking with a dog on Evergreen Road. 9:55 a.m., Tuolumne — A caller said the chain of a “no trespassing” sign on Tuolumne Road was cut sometime Saturday night. 11:47 a.m., Pinecrest — A woman on Pinecrest Lake Road said three kayaks were stolen. 1:37 p.m., Jamestown — A television was stolen on Seventh Street. Felony bookings FRIDAY 11:06 p.m., Sonora — Curtis Allan Schoon, 26, of the 23000 block of Stable Road, was booked on suspicion of violation of probation and threatening a crime with the intent to terrorize after an arrest at his home. SATURDAY 12:22 p.m., Sonora — Douglas Mitchell Alameda, 48, a transient, was booked on suspicion of causing a fire of a structure or forest land and assault with a deadly weapon after an arrest on Mill Villa Court. 2:54 p.m., Columbia — James Michael Tracy Jr., 27, of the 21000 Block of Jamestown Road, was booked on suspicion of possessing a controlled substance for sale and misdemeanor possession of a controlled substance paraphernalia after an arrest on Parrotts Ferry Road. Arrests Cited on suspicion of driving under the influence of drugs or alcohol: FRIDAY 9:19 p.m., Tuolumne — Keith Michael Brooks, 29, of the 9000 Block of Carrillo Way, La Grange, was booked after an arrest on Tuolumne Road at Carter Street. SATURDAY 3:15 a.m., Sonora — Daniel Emil Miller, 27, of the 24000 Block of Kewin Mill Road, was booked after an arrest on Longeway Road. 3:24 a.m., Sonora — John Albert Miller, 61, of the 24000 Block of Kewin Mill Road, was booked after an arrest on Longeway Road. SUNDAY
